Description: Wheelmade kaolinite ceramic beaker with simple direct rim, straight walls and angled lower half to flat base. Fabric very fine and creamy with few inclusions, of fine eggshell ware with wall thickness of 1.5mm. Re-assembled from fragments, missing part of rim. Covered in thick creamy slip; decorated with a frieze demarcated by two black painted bands below rim and two above angle of base; between, repeating pattern of trefoil flowers in black and red paint.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 19) (Type A17)
